headline.main: Allies Take Naoro From Foe Retreating in New Guinea; ALLIES TAKE NAORO IN NEW GUINEA PUSH

lead_paragraph: AT UNITED NATIONS HEADQUARTERS, Australia, Thursday, Oct. 1. -- The capture by Allied forces of Naoro, a jungle hamlet in the Owen Stanley Mountains, and a continued advance northward across New Guinea were reported officially today. The head quarters communique said that the Japanese were retiring ahead of the Allied advance and that, as a result, no contact had been made with the main body of enemy troops.
abstract: Allies take Naoro, New Guinea; bomb Jap supply lines, Menari area; blast Buna; damage Wairopi Bridge; raid Buin and Buka; New Guinea situation revd; lessening Jap air activity and Port Moresby facilities expansion cited
